Privacy Policy

Last updated: 20 February 2026

1. Information We Collect

At Antares Systems, we collect information to provide our IT Asset Disposition (ITAD) services and communicate effectively with our clients. The data we collect falls into the following categories:

Contact Forms

When you contact us through our website or service inquiry forms, we collect:

  • Your full name
  • Company name and position
  • Professional email address
  • Phone number
  • Type of IT asset disposition service required
  • Any additional information you choose to provide regarding your IT asset disposal needs

Cookies and Tracking Technologies

We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to:

  • Enhance your experience on our website
  • Analyze site usage and traffic patterns
  • Maintain website security
  • Remember your preferences

The cookies we use are strictly necessary for basic website functionality and do not collect personally identifiable information. You can disable cookies through your browser settings, though this may affect site functionality.

Service Delivery Information

In the course of providing our ITAD services, we may collect and process:

  • Asset manifests and inventory lists
  • Data destruction certificates
  • Compliance documentation
  • Service delivery records
  • Financial transaction information (processed through secure payment gateways)

2. How We Use Your Data

Antares Systems uses your information solely for the purposes of delivering our professional IT asset disposition services and maintaining business relationships. We may use your data to:

  • Provide ITAD services: Process your inquiries, deliver asset disposition solutions, and manage data destruction according to NIST 800-88 and HMG IS5 standards.
  • Communication: Respond to your inquiries, provide service updates, and share important compliance information relevant to your asset disposition projects.
  • Service improvement: Enhance our ITAD processes and maintain the highest standards of data security and environmental responsibility.
  • Compliance documentation: Maintain records as required by data protection laws, environmental regulations, and industry standards in the UK.
  • Legal obligations: Fulfill our responsibilities under UK GDPR, Data Protection Act 2018, and other applicable regulations.

We will never sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties for marketing purposes.

3. Data Security

As a specialist in IT asset disposition, Antares Systems maintains the highest standards of data security throughout all business processes. Your information is protected by:

  • Secure data handling protocols: All personal and business information is processed according to NCSC-approved security standards.
  • Secure data destruction: Physical assets containing data are destroyed using NIST 800-88 and HMG IS5 compliant methods, including mechanical shredding, degaussing, or secure erasure.
  • Secure storage: Digital data is stored on encrypted servers with robust access controls and 24/7 security monitoring.
  • Secure transmission: All data transmitted to or from our website is protected using SSL/TLS 1.2 or higher encryption.
  • Access control: Your information is only accessible to authorized personnel who require access to perform their duties.
  • Data retention: We retain your information only for as long as necessary to fulfill our legal and contractual obligations, or as required by relevant regulations in the asset disposition industry.
  • Supplier vetting: All third-party service providers are thoroughly vetted to ensure they meet our stringent data security and compliance requirements.

4. Compliance with GDPR and UK Data Protection Act

Antares Systems is fully committed to complying with all applicable data protection laws, including:

  • The UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR)
  • The Data Protection Act 2018
  • The Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations (PECR)

ICO Registration

Antares Systems is registered with the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) under registration number C18880232.

Lawful Basis for Processing

We process your information based on the following lawful grounds:

  • Contractual necessity: Processing is necessary for the performance of contracts or taking steps prior to entering into a contract.
  • Legal obligation: Processing is necessary for compliance with our legal obligations as an ITAD provider.
  • Legitimate interests: Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests in providing IT asset disposition services, subject to appropriate safeguards for your rights.

International Data Transfers

Antares Systems is a London-based company and all data processing activities occur within the UK. We do not routinely transfer personal data outside the United Kingdom. In the event that we must transfer data for specific operational purposes, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place as required by data protection laws.

5. Your Rights and Contact Information

Under UK data protection laws, you have several important rights concerning your personal information. You may exercise these rights at any time by contacting us using the details provided below.

  • The right to be informed about how your data is collected and used
  • The right to access the personal information we hold about you
  • The right to request correction of inaccurate or incomplete information
  • The right to request erasure of your data in certain circumstances
  • The right to restrict processing of your data in certain situations
  • The right to data portability for information you have provided
  • The right to object to processing based on legitimate interests
  • The right to withdraw consent where processing is based on consent
  • The right to lodge a complaint with the ICO or another supervisory authority

Contact Us

If you have any questions, concerns, or requests regarding this privacy policy or how we handle your personal information, please contact us:

Antares Systems
London CR2 8PD
United Kingdom

Email: contact@antaressystems.net

We will respond to your request within one calendar month, except in exceptional circumstances where we may need up to two additional months. If we ask you to verify your identity, the response time may be extended by the amount of time it takes to complete that verification.

Compliance Notice: This privacy policy has been drafted to comply with NIST 800-88, HMG IS5, UK GDPR, Data Protection Act 2018, and ICO guidelines. All data handling activities adhere to NCSC-approved security standards for secure IT asset disposition.

London-based ITAD provider delivering compliant asset disposal, secure data destruction, and international remarketing.
